name: nic-mp
params: wff w0, wff w1, wff w2

stmt.origin: mpbi(wi(w1, wa(w2, w0)), wnan(w1, wnan(w2, w0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(w1, wa(w2, w0))
-| wnan(w1, wnan(w2, w0))
-| wb(wnan(w1, wnan(w2, w0)), wi(w1, wa(w2, w0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- w0
-| w1
-| wnan(w1, wnan(w2, w0))
-| wb(wnan(w1, wnan(w2, w0)), wi(w1, wa(w2, w0)))

body.origin: |- wb(wnan(w1, wnan(w2, w0)), wi(w1, wa(w2, w0)))

comment: Derive Nicod's rule of modus ponens using 'nand', from the standard one. Although the major and minor premise together also imply ` ch ` , this form is necessary for useful derivations from ~ nic-ax . In a pure (standalone) treatment of Nicod's axiom, this theorem would be changed to an axiom ($a statement). (Contributed by Jeff Hoffman, 19-Nov-2007.) (Proof modification is discouraged.) (New usage is discouraged.)
